title: ICE with `const _: () = panic!(String::new());`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code ```Rust #![feature(const_panic)] const _: () = panic!(String::new()); ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.47.0-nightly (7e6d6e5f5 2020-08-16) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7e6d6e5f535321c2223f044caba16f97b825009c commit-date: 2020-08-16 host: i686-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.47.0-nightly LLVM version: 10.0 ``` ### Error output ``` error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir/interpret/operand.rs:327:13: primitive read failed for type: std::string::String --> src/lib.rs:3:15 | 3 | const _: () = panic!(String::new()); | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: this error: internal compiler error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/7e6d6e5f535321c2223f044caba16f97b825009c/src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:873:9 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.47.0-nightly (7e6d6e5f5 2020-08-16) running on i686-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden error: aborting due to previous error error: could not compile `foo`. ```
Backtrace

``` Compiling foo v0.1.0 (/home/matias/Documents/eclipse_workspace/tmp/foo) error: internal compiler error: src/librustc_mir/interpret/operand.rs:327:13: primitive read failed for type: std::string::String --> src/lib.rs:3:15 | 3 | const _: () = panic!(String::new()); | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: this error: internal compiler error originates in a macro (in Nightly builds, run with -Z macro-backtrace for more info) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/7e6d6e5f535321c2223f044caba16f97b825009c/src/librustc_errors/lib.rs:873:9 stack backtrace: 0: std::panicking::begin_panic 1: rustc_errors::HandlerInner::span_bug 2: rustc_errors::Handler::span_bug 3: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt::{{closure}} 4: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt::{{closure}} 5: rustc_middle::ty::context::tls::with_opt 6: rustc_middle::util::bug::opt_span_bug_fmt 7: rustc_middle::util::bug::span_bug_fmt 8: rustc_mir::interpret::place::>::deref_operand 9: rustc_mir::const_eval::machine::>::hook_panic_fn 10: ::find_mir_or_eval_fn 11: rustc_mir::interpret::terminator::>::eval_fn_call 12: rustc_mir::interpret::step::>::run 13: rustc_mir::const_eval::eval_queries::const_eval_raw_provider 14: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::const_eval_raw>::compute 15: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 16: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 17: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 18: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 19: rustc_mir::const_eval::eval_queries::const_eval_validated_provider 20: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::const_eval_validated>::compute 21: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 22: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 23: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 24: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 25: rustc_mir::const_eval::eval_queries::const_eval_validated_provider 26: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::const_eval_validated>::compute 27: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 28: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 29: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 30: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 31: rustc_middle::mir::interpret::queries::::const_eval_global_id 32: rustc_middle::mir::interpret::queries::::const_eval_poly 33: ::check_item 34: rustc_hir::intravisit::Visitor::visit_nested_item 35: rustc_hir::intravisit::walk_crate 36: rustc_lint::late::late_lint_crate 37: rustc_session::utils::::time 38: rustc_session::utils::::time 39: as core::ops::function::FnOnce<()>>::call_once 40: rustc_session::utils::::time 41: rustc_interface::passes::analysis 42: rustc_middle::ty::query:: for rustc_middle::ty::query::queries::analysis>::compute 43: rustc_middle::dep_graph::::with_deps 44: rustc_query_system::dep_graph::graph::DepGraph::with_task_impl 45: rustc_data_structures::stack::ensure_sufficient_stack 46: rustc_query_system::query::plumbing::get_query_impl 47: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 48: rustc_span::with_source_map 49: rustc_interface::interface::create_compiler_and_run 50: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.47.0-nightly (7e6d6e5f5 2020-08-16) running on i686-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: #0 [const_eval_raw] const-evaluating `_` #1 [const_eval_validated] const-evaluating + checking `_` #2 [const_eval_validated] const-evaluating + checking `_` #3 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error error: could not compile `foo`. ```
